com.yantra.wms.japi.ue

Interface WMSOverridePickLocationAssignmentUE

  • Deprecated. 
    This UE is deprecated as of Sterling Selling and Fulfillment Suite v9.1.

    public interface WMSOverridePickLocationAssignmentUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document overridePickLocationAssignment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The WMSOverridePickLocationAssignmentUE user exit is called by release wave and releaseMoveRequest before assigning a location to any existing demand.

    • Method Detail

      • overridePickLocationAssignment

        org.w3c.dom.Document overridePickLocationAssignment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Deprecated. 

        The WMSOverridePickLocationAssignmentUE user exit is called by release wave and releaseMoveRequest before assigning a location to any existing demand. The API/ agent does the following:

        • Determines the location from where the demand can be fulfilled.
        • Determines the task type for each pick.


        The user exit can override the location assignment and/or the task type. The user exit is called even if API cannot assign the location for partial/complete demand. It is assumed that inventory is available at the locations returned by user exit. To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Defaults:

        • If user exit implementation is not found then, the algorithm uses the priority zone list determined from the put away preferences
        • If null document is returned then no location is suggested.
        • If the returned document contains zone that do not belong to the Node given in /ActivityConstraint element then this zone is removed from the priority zone list.

        The user exit implementation can get the enterprise code from the environment variable by calling the getUEParam(String variable) method.

        Example : env.getUEParam("EnterpriseCode")


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the user exit.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML that contains attributes as required by the user exit. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
